Hi Peter, 
   Did you eventually modify SharpNeat to support validation da=
ta
sets? Or does anybody know if there any Neat implementations/code
snippe=
ts etc out there (SharpNeat or otherwise) that support
cross-validation? 

=
As I am fairly new to NEAT, I begun by searching around for SharpNeat
and n=
oticed that there are at least three different implementations:
SourceForge=
, codeplex and a version supporting HyperNeat/.NET 2.0.  Is
there by chance=
 a central CVS/Subversion repository coordinating these
together where the =
SharpNeat project is maintained and/or the patches
for update versions avai=
lable? 

Thanks,
Keith.

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "petervermont" <pandr=
ews@...> wrote:
>
> In the recent thread "New To NEAT - A few Newbie Questi=
ons" Ken wrote:
> 
> >What you do is evaluate each
> >generation on the tra=
ining set and test the champion of each
> >generation on the validation set=
. When the validation scores start
> >going down, you stop evolution.
> 
> =
I am using SharpNEAT and am new to all this so I would appreciate a
> littl=
e more detail.
> 
> I have implemented two interface, IExperiment and INetw=
orkEvaluator.
> Neither interface appears to have any concept of a generati=
on or of a
> champion. It looks to me like I might want/need to subclass
> =
SingleFilePopulationEvaluator so that I can override
> EvaluatePopulation. =
I can then call the superclass' EvaluatePopulation
> and after it completes=
 do my validation testing on the
> EvolutionAlgorithm's BestGenome. I was t=
hen thinking
> that once I wished to stop evolution, I could set the
> Evol=
utionAlgorithm SearchCompleted boolean. Finally, I can modify
> SharpNeatGu=
i's SearchThread to check the ea's SearchCompleted flag so
> that the threa=
d will stop.
> 
> Am I on the right track here? How have others handled cro=
ss-validation
> and prevention of over-fitting?
> 
> Thanks,
> 
> Peter
>

=
